content: The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends various assistance programs for veterans and their families, including monthly assistance allowance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee. The Act also provides funding for the United States Olympic Committee for the specified period. The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends assistance programs for veterans and their families, including monthly allowance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee until December 31, 2013. Amendments include changing references from United States Paralympics, Inc. to United States Olympic Committee and specifying applicability to Commonwealths and Territories of the United States. The Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013 extends assistance programs for veterans and their families, including monthly allowance for disabled veterans invited by the United States Olympic Committee until December 31, 2013. The act also includes provisions for entities like the American Samoa National Olympic Committee, Guam National Olympic Committee, Comite Olimpico de Puerto Rico, and others to represent the interests of the Northern Mariana Islands and the United States Virgin Islands. Extension of various authorities affecting veterans, including the collection of copayments for hospital and nursing home care, recovery from third parties for care costs, homeless veterans reintegration programs, and referral services for at-risk veterans transitioning from institutions, all extended to later dates in 2014. Extension of various authorities affecting veterans, including funding for homeless veterans programs and supportive services, extended to later dates in 2014. Specifically, funding amounts for comprehensive service programs, financial assistance for low-income veteran families, and grant programs for homeless veterans with special needs are adjusted for fiscal years 2014 and 2015. Additionally, eligibility for specially adapted housing assistance for veterans with disabilities is temporarily expanded. In 2014, amendments were made to various sections of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010, including limitations on approving assistance applications for disabled veterans and extending the authority to calculate net value of real property securing defaulted loans. Additionally, a pilot program on assistance for child care for certain veterans receiving health care was extended to a 3-year period. Amendments were made to the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 in 2014, including extending the authority for income verification purposes for certain veterans benefits. The Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 was amended in 2014 to extend the authority for income verification for certain veterans benefits until November 18, 2011, and 180 days after the enactment of the Department of Veterans Affairs Expiring Authorities Act of 2013. The Act will take effect on October 1, 2013, with certain sections effective on September 30, 2013. Actions taken by the Department of Veterans Affairs under the extended authorities will be ratified if the Act is not enacted by September 30, 2013. The budgetary effects of the Act will be determined by the latest statement submitted by the Chairman of the Senate Budget Committee for compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go-Act of 2010.
